noun.description: A picture or pattern produced by arranging together small colored pieces of hard material, such as stone, tile, or glass.
examples: the walls and vaults are decorated by marble and mosaic
the mosaic shows the baptism of Christ

noun.description: An individual (especially an animal) composed of cells of two genetically different types.
A viral disease that results in leaf variegation in tobacco, corn, sugar cane, and other plants.

examples: he mosaicked the walls, ceilings, and floors

origin: Mid 17th century: from French mosaïque or modern Latin Mosaicus.
